excerpts:
* Whiz Burger ($8.75) - 3.5 stars
Good!
This is the only burger that comes on a French Roll, which while more classy, makes for a drier/crunchier bread.
Otherwise the ingredients are fresh, and they are nicely balanced.
For the patty, I asked for "medium rare" and I think the guy chuckled.. not sure if they do that, and mine was pretty much a medium.
whiz burger.author: Ziyan C.
whiz burger.review:
High 3 stars. We walk by Whiz Burgers all the time and have always been curious - are they any good? How do they stay in business? (They always seem empty)

Turns out they have pretty good burgers. Still unclear how they are still around, but turns out they are pretty historic and used to be a legit drive through (turned parking lot. Maybe that's how they stay afloat nowadays). 

On top of the decent burger, there's also no wait, it's cheap, and they have a great banana shake. It's worth a stop by here to try it out!

THE FOOD:

* Garlic Fries ($4.95) - 2.5 stars
The fries, while thick cut (which I like), were too dry. Also, this smelled strongly of garlic, but when we opened it, it looked like plain fries. Where was the garlic? We could taste it, but not as strongly as when the fries are covered with freshly chopped garlic. 

* Fresh Banana Shake ($4.70) - 4 stars
Usually I avoid banana in any smoothie I get as I feel it's overpowering, but here it tasted great! Made fresh, nice thick texture.

* Whiz Burger ($8.75) - 3.5 stars
Good! This is the only burger that comes on a French Roll, which while more classy, makes for a drier/crunchier bread. Otherwise the ingredients are fresh, and they are nicely balanced. For the patty, I asked for "medium rare" and I think the guy chuckled.. not sure if they do that, and mine was pretty much a medium.

excerpts: Next time will try the whiz burger
whiz burger.author: Dkac C.
whiz burger.review: Good sized tasty burgers.  Fries are good also.  Onion rings not worth it.  I got the Jr. burger which seems like the size of a whopper.   Next time will try the whiz burger

excerpts: How surprised was I (very) when I took my first bite of the Whiz Burger.
It was fresh, it was tasty.
Simple & a little messy.
That's good.
whiz burger.author: Veronica M.
whiz burger.review:
Ok. I'd read that a prominent SF chef loves this place.

I thought, if it's good enough for him, it's good enough for me.

Yes, it does have an overall decrepit look about it.

There's no denying that this joint could use some serious TLC.

But, we can all use a little, or a lot, of TLC, can't we?

I saw that they have a perfect health score.  I found this reassuring.

So, crumbling facade aside, I focused on the food.  Meaning...the burger.

How surprised was I (very) when I took my first bite of the Whiz Burger.  It was fresh, it was tasty.  Simple & a little messy.  That's good.  A lot of previous reviewers have called it classic, & that's exactly what it is...

A classic burger.

It's very reminiscent of an old school backyard burger from a prior era.  

A burger that Edith would have made for Archie Bunker.

If it's good enough for Archie Bunker...

4 stars.

excerpts: Whiz Burger, fries, Banana shake.
Why, yes!
Delicious!!
The way the cheese melts around the bacon, sliced down the middle, wrapped like a gift!
And those fries!
As for the shake, I'm not really into bananas.
whiz burger.author: Elizabeth Q.
whiz burger.review:
Fast becoming my guilty pleasure...

Driven by here for years, always grabbed my attention. Could it possibly be true? A fantastic, old school burger in SF? 

Whiz Burger, fries, Banana shake. Why, yes! Delicious!! The way the cheese melts around the bacon, sliced down the middle, wrapped like a gift! And those fries! As for the shake, I'm not really into bananas. Until now.

I can feel the pounds packing on. And I just don't care.

excerpts: Whiz Burger doesn't pretend to be anything it's not.
whiz burger.author: Marz C.
whiz burger.review:
I think one of the previous reviews hit the nail on the head "greasy, hot, fresh, disgusting, and perfect."

Whiz Burger doesn't pretend to be anything it's not. Once you accept that, you will be happy. 

This place is a hangover go-to. Garlic fries are greasy, soggy, mega garlicky, and delicious. Burgers are OK. Their shakes are legit. I do not recommend the cheese steak.

excerpts: Whiz Burger:
whiz burger.author: Megan G.
whiz burger.review:
Whiz Burger: It's just the best.

They have a veggie burger! You can add avocado!

The seasoned (waffle) fries are delicious. And the root beer float is a tall foamy classic at the lowest price in town.

excerpts: Whiz burger with crosscut fries and a shake
Never have had a bad experience with this place and always happy&full after one of their burgers
whiz burger.author: Mandy F.
whiz burger.review:
Easily one of my favorite burger places in the city. 
Whiz burger with crosscut fries and a shake
Never have had a bad experience with this place and always happy&full after one of their burgers

excerpts: Definitely go for the whiz burger.
The entire sandwich was exceptional.
The meat, avocado, bacon, all was perfect.
Freshness score was a 5 as well.
Visiting family, we are from San Diego, and this will be a must return.
Do not be fooled by the looks of the place, or neighborhood.
They had a 92 on the health inspection.
Loved it, the end.
whiz burger.author: Scott B.
whiz burger.review: OMG! Best burger ever! Definitely go for the whiz burger. The entire sandwich was exceptional. The meat, avocado, bacon, all was perfect. Freshness score was a 5 as well. Visiting family, we are from San Diego, and this will be a must return. Do not be fooled by the looks of the place, or neighborhood. They had a 92 on the health inspection. Loved it, the end.

excerpts: The whiz burger is pretty much where it's at.
Bacon, avocado, burger, all on a french roll, sliced at a diagonal through the center.
Mmmm, delicious.
Fries are good too.
I suspect the other items are good too, but I can't really vouch for them.
whiz burger.author: Brent W.
whiz burger.review:
This place is freakin' great, and I'm not sure why the other reviews are so polarized. (Although, the one about the car getting towed from the parking lot is pretty funny). However, you can't hold that against them in a review about food. Plus, there are a number of other snarky comments related to the neighborhood and it's "up-and-coming" appearance, but whatever.

This is pretty much the ultimate burger drive in. It has hilarious (and original decor), a cool retro feel. The whiz burger is pretty much where it's at. Bacon, avocado, burger, all on a french roll, sliced at a diagonal through the center. Mmmm, delicious. Fries are good too. I suspect the other items are good too, but I can't really vouch for them. We did try the banana shake, which was delicious and tasted like it had a whole banana blended up in there (which it probably did!). 

Check this place out the next time you've had one beer too many at a bar down the street. You won't regret it.

excerpts: My boyfriend got the Whiz Burger, which comes with avocado.
It was deeeeelicious and actually had me wishing
I'd ordered that instead.
He also got a banana shake.
whiz burger.author: Josephine L.
whiz burger.review:
The place screams SKETCHY with a capital "SK", but the food itself isn't so bad and the prices sure are cheap. My boyfriend is a good ol' American guy who loves his red meat, and his craving for burgers and other greasy, unhealthy American goodies brought us here one balmy summer night.

I went with the chicken wings and fries combo because fried meat and potatoes is one of the greatest food combinations ever invented. The wings were tender but tiny, so if you're hungry do not go for just 7, which I thought would be enough. The batter was nice and salty, but lacked other seasoning so came across as kind of bland. 

My boyfriend got the Whiz Burger, which comes with avocado. It was deeeeelicious and actually had me wishing I'd ordered that instead. He also got a banana shake. I'm not really into shakes and the banana shake had too much artificial banana flavoring for my liking, but it probably wouldn't be so bad for fans of banana-flavored dairy.

It's probably best not to come here alone unless you're 6.5" and built like a rock. However, the sketchy-looking people generally don't bother you. They might leer at you for a while, but then they usually find some other moving object to leer at.

excerpts:
what i ordered... whiz burger

typical hamburger patties and fillings served in a faux sourdough bread


ambiance...
whiz burger.author: Gors P.
whiz burger.review:
what i ordered... whiz burger

typical hamburger patties and fillings served in a faux sourdough bread


ambiance... bad (it looks like one of 'em structure in the ol' west movies)
service... so-so (a stare and a quick question but a single word of gratitude at the end)
cost... $ (fair)

excerpts: Whiz Burger is definitely a "classic" burger with mustard served on top of fresh shredded lettuce and a thin meat patty.
the flavors are bold and reminiscent of something you'd eat at a carnival.
whiz burger.author: Kevin J.
whiz burger.review:
Sketch-y.  truly a unique "dining" experience.  Have you ever been to a drive up movie theater?  Well I haven't either, but this place surely reminds me of what that would be like.  The building is obviously run-down and the insides are left to the imagination with posters and menus posted all over the windowed store front so you can't see inside.  

The food was good, much to my surprise. Don't get me wrong, as I was happy to have paid for and eaten good food, but you don't expect what you end up getting dished out.  Whiz Burger is definitely a "classic" burger with mustard served on top of fresh shredded lettuce and a thin meat patty.  the flavors are bold and reminiscent of something you'd eat at a carnival.  A good carnival.

Make sure to try out the criss-cut fries as they were perfectly crispy and deliciously hot.  Bottom line - I'd go back.

excerpts: whiz burger is my favorite self indulgent lunch.
mmmm.
whiz burger.author: Cat G.
whiz burger.review:
greasy, hot, fresh, disgusting, and perfect. 

whiz burger is my favorite self indulgent lunch. mmmm. it's so bad, but so so good. 

I hope this place is around forever.

excerpts: Whiz Burger could use a bit of a fix me up.
Their retro bar stools are now missing their cushioned tops and the place looks in dire need of a paint job.
I like to think it's part of their charm.
Either way, it is SO GOOD.
There has been countless overhyped burger joints opening.
Granted they're all amazing
but sometimes you just want a greasy cheeseburger with no fuss
Look no further on the menu - the Whiz Burger is all you need.
It's everything a classic burger should be.
whiz burger.author: Samantha L.
whiz burger.review:
Whiz Burger could use a bit of a fix me up. Their retro bar stools are now missing their cushioned tops and the place looks in dire need of a paint job. I like to think it's part of their charm. Either way, it is SO GOOD. There has been countless overhyped burger joints opening. Granted they're all amazing but sometimes you just want a greasy cheeseburger with no fuss and that isn't $15.

Look no further on the menu - the Whiz Burger is all you need. It's everything a classic burger should be. The bacon gives it just enough delicious fattiness (flavor!!), onions, lettuce, avocado, pickles, mustard and mayo completes it.

They have all the typical milkshake flavors but try their banana milkshake. It's sweet and just the right thick consistency.

excerpts: We really liked Whiz Burger, it was great.
whiz burger.author: Lani N.
whiz burger.review:
We really liked Whiz Burger, it was great.   

We got 2 burger burgers with cheese, 1 seasoned fries (criss cut), onion rings, a soda, and a strawberry shake. The criss cut fries and onion rings were nothing to write home about. The burgers were delish. Great bun (perfect bun to meat/topping ration). Simple burger set up: mayo, lettuce, pickle, tomato, onion. Burger: 1/2 inch thick, well seasoned. The best way I can describe them is that they are similar to In-and-Out but better, and more homemade. The strawberry shake was also very good.  

We'll be back :)  

They had a health score of 100, awesome!

excerpts: Whiz Burger has been here since 1955 for a reason, awesome burgers fries and shakes all around!!
whiz burger.author: O. S.
whiz burger.review: You can keep your $20 artisan gourmet Valencia St burgers. Whiz Burger has been here since 1955 for a reason, awesome burgers fries and shakes all around!!

excerpts: Whiz Burger has terrible customer service and the food is below In-n-out quality.
DONT BOTHER with their nasty wet (yes, like water wet) french fries.
I wish someone would come take over who knows how to cook correctly.
whiz burger.author: Steve S.
whiz burger.review: I live couple blocks away  and went here about 5 times and never got my order right. I confront the   cashier and he is just like you are out of luck. Whiz Burger has terrible customer service and the food is below In-n-out quality. DONT BOTHER with their nasty wet (yes, like water wet) french fries.   I wish someone would come take over who knows how to cook correctly.

excerpts: Their specialty is their Whiz Burger and boy is it special.
whiz burger.author: Murphy O.
whiz burger.review:
Man oh man oh man oh man. I love this place! 

I was searching for a burger place in SF to call my own. I searched far and wide, but the burgers were either too expensive or too bland...or both! And then I stumbled upon this place.

What a pleasant surprise. In an overpriced city such as San Francisco it's nice to find a cheap place to eat with a whole lot of character. Their specialty is their Whiz Burger and boy is it special. They make a mighty fine banana shake as well. 

See ya there?

excerpts:
Dearest Whiz Burger,
I miss you so much.
I used to order seasoned fries, a banana milkshake and a veggie burger from here
whenever my dad was feelin' like a burger and fries.
Holy mother of YES.
I just miss this place so much.
I basically grew up eating their burgers all the time.
This was my in-n-out before in-n-out in Daly City came into existence.
This place is legit, but i wouldn't recommend actually eating there.
It's rather unsanitary.
Take it to go.
I'd give it one more star if the seats weren't full of bird shit.
whiz burger.author: Kai S.
whiz burger.review:
Dearest Whiz Burger,
I miss you so much. I used to order seasoned fries, a banana milkshake and a veggie burger from here whenever my dad was feelin' like a burger and fries. Holy mother of YES. I just miss this place so much. I basically grew up eating their burgers all the time. This was my in-n-out before in-n-out in Daly City came into existence. This place is legit, but i wouldn't recommend actually eating there. It's rather unsanitary. Take it to go. I'd give it one more star if the seats weren't full of bird shit.

excerpts: I got the burger burger, which I was told was basically the Whiz burger without avocado and bacon.
The meat was almost like highschool lunch burger mystery meat, on par with McDonalds.
whiz burger.author: Skye W.
whiz burger.review:
Props for being here since 1955!

I got the burger burger, which I was told was basically the Whiz burger without avocado and bacon.  The meat was almost like highschool lunch burger mystery meat, on par with McDonalds.  Luckily it came with pickles and enough mustard to mask the taste.  

I stopped by while walking my dog (there aren't many places that you can grab food with a dog, well a large dog).  I wanted to sit outside and eat, but seriously there were too many homeless people and my dog was scared.

I heard their shakes are amazing- too bad I'm lactose intolerant. 

Cool that it's still around, but run down, and almost gross

excerpts: Not to much for the whiz burger, but boy do they give you enough fries.
Since this was my first time there I give it another try.
I will ask the locals what to get.
Says its been there a long time and it looked it, but looks are deceiving.
whiz burger.author: Biggg J.
whiz burger.review: Not to much for the whiz burger, but boy do they give you enough fries. Since this was my first time there I give it another try. I will ask the locals what to get. Says its been there a long time and it looked it, but looks are deceiving.

excerpts: Whiz Burger is a solid old school burger stand.
It is not in the best neighborhood.
I am a big guy, and I can take care of myself, but I don't invite danger.
My spider sense tingles
every time I go to this place as soon as I turn my back to the street and step up to the window to order.
This is not an eat-in place.
The outdoor stools and picnic tables, forget it.
whiz burger.author: Shaun H.
whiz burger.review:
Whiz Burger is a solid old school burger stand.  It is not in the best neighborhood.  I am a big guy, and I can take care of myself, but I don't invite danger.  My spider sense tingles every time I go to this place as soon as I turn my back to the street and step up to the window to order.  This is not an eat-in place.  The outdoor stools and picnic tables, forget it.  This is an eat it in your car or at home far away from here kind of place.

Location aside, their bacon double is FANTASTIC.  Their fries are solid.  Shakes are good enough.

It is worth a try, but go at sun up and take it home with you.

excerpts: Whiz Burger is a place that you don't want to admit to enjoying.
It's an old fashioned drive it and fast food at it's greasiest.
However, it's a San Francisco classic and when you are up for a splurge (I do mean calories, not cash)
it's worth it!
It's exactly what you would expect burgers and fries, shakes and malts.
Not exactly culinary grandeur but what do you expect from a fast food burger joint.
whiz burger.author: Marissa P.
whiz burger.review:
Whiz Burger is a place that you don't want to admit to enjoying. It's an old fashioned drive it and fast food at it's greasiest. However, it's a San Francisco classic and when you are up for a splurge (I do mean calories, not cash) it's worth it! It's exactly what you would expect burgers and fries, shakes and malts. Not exactly culinary grandeur but what do you expect from a fast food burger joint. You could go to a big chain burger place or enjoy a snap shot from San Francisco days past. 

Pros
- The shakes, malts and root beer floats
- Seasoned fries
- Pretty good burger (not as greasy as some)
- Takes credit cards

Cons
- The regular fries are bland and not worth the calories!
- Closes down fairly early

excerpts: I got the Whiz Burger
I went asked the dumb question of, "What's on a Whiz Burger?" because the toppings seemed to be a mystery on all three types of menus in front of me.
He didn't blink though....rolling out bacon/avocado
and then all of the other toppings.
whiz burger.author: Mike H.
whiz burger.review:
I was craving good, simple food to take home, having just flown back from a 48hr trip for an east coast trade show. I got the Whiz Burger and I'd recommend it to anyone else looking for something quick to eat/order. 

My meal definitely was better than expected, maybe because of the delicious french fries. I couldn't get enough of them! Hopefully pre-salting isn't all that it takes to satisfy my fry taste buds. I don't think I was that worn out.

The building and its location weren't a big deal. I enjoyed Whiz more than Beeps, which is set up similarly. Parking next to the building, followed by a quick to-go order, was perfect for me. When I walked up to the window, a guy came around from the back counter and was on his cell phone. For some reason, this didn't surprise me. I went asked the dumb question of, "What's on a Whiz Burger?" because the toppings seemed to be a mystery on all three types of menus in front of me. He didn't blink though....rolling out bacon/avocado and then all of the other toppings. Guy's a pro.

The shake was ready after a few minutes. I'm not a shake guy but Yelp reviews encouraged me to try it. The actual strawberries used were appreciated. The burger and fries came out just a few minutes later. Pretty darn fast. In that time, one person was ahead of me, and two followed with orders at 5pm. (Remember, my body was feeling 8pm, especially after the previous night.)

It was a good deal: $12 for a burger with bacon, avocado, adding cheese, along with fries and a shake. Sure, we can spend hard-earned money at a ton of places in the Mission, not to mention all of SF, but very few places make fries THIS GOOD. Am I too easily pleased by salty fries? Maybe, maybe not. Go there yourself, and then let me know.

excerpts: Whiz burger is a good decent place.
To this day, it's still a good decent place.
Good burgers and good memories.
5 stars for still being around and bringing me back memories when i'm around.
whiz burger.author: Nelson M.
whiz burger.review:
I use to live a few houses away from Whiz ever since i was born in 1985. Whiz burger is a good decent place. To this day, it's still a good decent place. Good burgers and good memories. 
5 stars for still being around and bringing me back memories when i'm around.

excerpts: the Whiz Burger was just bland.
The meat wasn't great and it fell apart as soon as it was unwrapped.
It's worth the visit just for the building but don't expect to be blown away by the Whiz Burger.
Their root beer was bangin, though.
whiz burger.author: Corbin C.
whiz burger.review:
The awesome storefront at the Whiz suckered me into getting one of their burgers. It oozes 50's charm out of that big glass window, over the picnic tables and onto Van Ness. 

I was hoping the burger would have the same sort of personality, if it's possible for a burger to have one. Yeah, burgers can have personalities.

The guy at the counter asked if I wanted everything on it and I said yes, assuming that meant lettuce, pickle, tomato, onion...the burger basics. I didn't know it meant adding bacon, avocado, and more cheese at an extra charge. Oh well, I thought, more toppings more flavor. 

Despite the extra fixins the Whiz Burger was just bland. The meat wasn't great and it fell apart as soon as it was unwrapped. And I would say it was more of a hoagie with hamburger meat on it than an actual burger. 

It's worth the visit just for the building but don't expect to be blown away by the Whiz Burger. Their root beer was bangin, though.

excerpts: For years I had avoided Whiz Burger for a myriad of reasons.
It's on the corner of Shady Lane and Ghetto Way for starters.
It looks physically run down, just like most hipster joints - and sorry, but that doesn't exactly scream 'sanitary' or 'delicious' to me.
Also, it's a burger joint
whiz burger.author: Amber K.
whiz burger.review:
Wow! 5 stars, definitely. 

For years I had avoided Whiz Burger for a myriad of reasons. It's on the corner of Shady Lane and Ghetto Way for starters. It looks physically run down, just like most hipster joints - and sorry, but that doesn't exactly scream 'sanitary' or 'delicious' to me. Also, it's a burger joint and I'm a vegetarian, so we're automatically at odds with each other. 

But, my curiosity got to me this time. I walked past and noticed their giant menu, and mango and banana milkshakes screamed out at me. So I kept looking, and to my surprise I saw grilled cheese and veggie burgers. And I was hungry, so thought, 'what the hell?' 

The veggie burger was AWESOME! It was the tofu kind, I think it tasted like Wildwood, which is my absolute fav. It stayed delicious even after it was luke warm. AND? They have seasoned fries. And they were amazing. Light, fluffy on the inside, crispy on the outside. I abstained from getting a shake, but I will next time.

Mmmm. Next time....

excerpts: Yah, if you live next to Whiz Burger and don't care what you are eating, Whiz is for you.
If you are passing by....just Whiz on by, keep going.
Not a place that will see me a second time.
whiz burger.author: Matsuo U.
whiz burger.review:
Passed by Whiz many times and wanted to try.
Had a burger / fries  lunch.....hmmm, it was GEE WHIZ but not in a good way. Cool looking place. Grouchy folks taking the food order. Hamburger was well, basic at best. Fries were OK, a bit soggy. 

Yah, if you live next to Whiz Burger and don't care what you are eating, Whiz is for you. If you are passing by....just Whiz on by, keep going. 
Not a place that will see me a second time.

excerpts: That's when I go to Whiz Burger.
Turkey burger is not bad.
whiz burger.author: Paul S.
whiz burger.review:
This is pretty terrible food, but bad in a way that is like how a really bad movie can be good and surprisingly entertaining.

Now and then, because I live down the street, I need something quick and cheap. 

And I need that special Whiz taste.

That's when I go to Whiz Burger.  Turkey burger is not bad.  I like that there is not another place like this in SF.

Sometimes you gotta get your food Whizzed on.

excerpts:
Whiz Burger Haiku

Come for the burger
whiz burger.author: Shannon N.
whiz burger.review:
Whiz Burger Haiku

Come for the burger
Homeless drunks ask for your change
"Sorry, just spent it"

excerpts: So when the boy, on an eager quest to find the best burger in the city, said 'Whiz Burger', I was in.
When he said 'the veggie burgers are really good
whiz burger.author: Dana S.
whiz burger.review:
Confession one:  I am a vegetarian who hates veggie burgers.  It's like eating a bread sandwich, but worse--I mean, I actually like bread. 

Confession two:  I a sucker for anything old and/or divey.  

So when the boy, on an eager quest to find the best burger in the city, said 'Whiz Burger', I was in.  When he said 'the veggie burgers are really good' I was skeptical.  

I am happy to report that--omg--the veggie burgers are. really. good.  They're made of tofu and vegetables and get crispy on the outside, and are nothing at all like a bread sandwich. 

That, plus waffle fries and half a fresh banana shake, left me in food coma all Sunday.

excerpts: I look forward to my climbing days over at mission cliffs just for my trip to Whiz Burger right after.
I have never had a more delicious hamburger.
Hands down.
whiz burger.author: Lotan K.
whiz burger.review:
Look, your not going to find a fancy burger joint here. The place is physically falling apart... which is awesome for me because the food is so good that the unappealing aspects of the place keeps the line short :)

I look forward to my climbing days over at mission cliffs just for my trip to Whiz Burger right after.
I have never had a more delicious hamburger. Hands down.

excerpts: Whiz Burger has some awesome grub, I'll tell you that.
The signature eponymous burger comes complete with avocado for a nice departure from the ordinary burger joint offering.
There's also vegetarian options, chicken burgers, etc.
whiz burger.author: Wes T.
whiz burger.review:
Whiz Burger has some awesome grub, I'll tell you that. The signature eponymous burger comes complete with avocado for a nice departure from the ordinary burger joint offering. There's also vegetarian options, chicken burgers, etc. Garlic fries, shakes, you can get what you need here to get that burger joint fill.

The real neat thing about The Whiz is the outdoor seating which is especially awesome when the weather cooperates.

Prices are a little steep, but you get a nice portions, so you can't really complain.

excerpts: Eating your food at the bar stools with your back to Van Ness is up there with bending over for soap in jail or taking pills you find on the ground (both of which have more than a tangential relationship with Whiz Burger as a whole).
With that said, I really really like the titular Whiz Burger.
The right amount of everything; cheese, beef, bacon, and avocado in proportionate moderation, cooling tomato, iceberg lettuce, onion, condiments on a nice, soft, toasted roll.
whiz burger.author: Milk N.
whiz burger.review:
Don't mistake this four star review for tacit approval. This is a disgusting, borderline hazardous hell hole. Even the food items I'm comfortable consuming I can't vouch for entirely. You have to embrace the concept of beneficial stress to really get behind ordering food here. Actually dining at the outside tables would be taking things past bravado and on down into "cry for help" behavior. Eating your food at the bar stools with your back to Van Ness is up there with bending over for soap in jail or taking pills you find on the ground (both of which have more than a tangential relationship with Whiz Burger as a whole). 

With that said, I really really like the titular Whiz Burger. The right amount of everything; cheese, beef, bacon, and avocado in proportionate moderation, cooling tomato, iceberg lettuce, onion, condiments on a nice, soft, toasted roll. The redundant "Burger Burger" is actually a single, reasonable burger. I won't belabor the rest, it's all what you'd expect. 

Take a walk on the wild side but eat it at home and keep your guard up while waiting like Inspector Cleaseu coming home to Kato (i.e. calm, friendly but prepared to defend yourself).

excerpts: Even if you have the stomach for it, Whiz Burger's food is nothing special.
whiz burger.author: Rachel C.
whiz burger.review:
The burger was pretty tasty (avocado wasn't ripe -- blech!).  Both the regular and spicy waffle fries were very tasty.  

Unfortunately, my digestive tract did not enjoy dinner so much.  I went with a friend who can eat anything, and she had some problems with it, too.  Even if you have the stomach for it, Whiz Burger's food is nothing special.

excerpts: I've passed by Whiz Burger so many times and have always wanted to come here!
Other than that, I would come back to Whiz Burger; perhaps for a shake next time!
whiz burger.author: Audrey K.
whiz burger.review:
I've passed by Whiz Burger so many times and have always wanted to come here! I love the old school and somewhat ghetto look of the place, and often times places like these can be the gems that surpass newer and fancier places. 

During our sub-par garage sale, I walked over here with my sweet baby on this past sunny Saturday afternoon.  I ordered the turkey burger with cheese meal, and my lady ordered the veggie burger solo (so we shared the fries and drink). Our total was around $14, which I guess isn't too bad. It turned out to be plenty of food so I'm glad we opted to not get the additional order of fries.

My turkey burger was big and tasty, and had all the fixins. The fries were really good, and there's nothing I dislike more than a crappy fry. Overall I thought my food was pretty good!

One thing I didn't really like was the way you order. You go up to the window, which is fine, but they didn't give me a receipt or a number. My lady had to stay and claim the table and I stood around by what I assumed was food window. It would be nice if they just called out your number when your food was ready so you don't stand there hovering like an idiot!

Other than that, I would come back to Whiz Burger; perhaps for a shake next time!

excerpts: Upon my first visit to Whiz Burger
I was distracted from ordering by a hobo searching the contents of their garbage can.
The hobo was so dirty he looked like a coal miner.
The elastic band in his athletic pants had long since succumbed to the stress of the hobo lifestyle.
This allowed myself and church goers across the street a clear view of his dirty hobo underwear.
whiz burger.author: Dinner Dog X.
whiz burger.review:
Upon my first visit to Whiz Burger I was distracted from ordering by a hobo searching the contents of their garbage can. The hobo was so dirty he looked like a coal miner. The elastic band in his athletic pants had long since succumbed to the stress of the hobo lifestyle. This allowed myself and church goers across the street a clear view of his dirty hobo underwear. Except he wasn't wearing any underwear.

Exhausted in his effort to liberate some fries, and then some ketchup from the trash, he laid out on the sidewalk for a much needed rest. A few minutes later he awoke and began eating the bounty that laid waiting before him. It was at this point I lost my appetite and went home.

If you should see a hobo wearing a toeless sneaker on one foot and on the other, a black boot, you may also want to pray for his soul.

excerpts: Whiz burger is the perfect place to go for a great yet simple burger.
With great burgers, tasty fries, and delicious shakes, This place is worth the time.
whiz burger.author: Michael E.
whiz burger.review: Whiz burger is the perfect place to go for a great yet simple burger. With great burgers, tasty fries, and delicious shakes, This place is worth the time.

excerpts: I ordered a Whiz burger w American cheese and everything (not knowing what was on it) and a banana shake.
The shake was handmade and featured a perfectly ripe and then-peeled banana and was totally delicious.
The Whiz, it turns out, includes my two favorite burger tops - bacon and avocado.
This is a great burger!
It was also a double decker.
$11 for the pair
, I'm a huge fan and I will definitely go back and dive deeper into the menu.
whiz burger.author: Matt S.
whiz burger.review: Even though I lived nearby for a year, I had NEVER been to Whiz until this afternoon.  DANG that's a great burger!  I ordered a Whiz burger w American cheese and everything (not knowing what was on it) and a banana shake.  The shake was handmade and featured a perfectly ripe and then-peeled banana and was totally delicious.  The Whiz, it turns out, includes my two favorite burger tops - bacon and avocado.  This is a great burger!  It was also a double decker.  $11 for the pair, I'm a huge fan and I will definitely go back and dive deeper into the menu.

excerpts: Whiz Burger's burgers and fries are okay, maybe even good.
The milkshakes are good.
The service is fair, and somewhat prompt.
The prices aren't great, but aren't horrible.

After the initial "Oh my god, someone stole my car" hysteria had passed, and after long investigation with the manager, I found out the story went this way:

Whiz Burger is near a Korean church.
Many of the attendees had parked in the Whiz Burger lot without paying, so the owner of Whiz Burger called and had all the cars in the lot towed during the service.

Now, before we talk about poor Ben and all the trouble I was put to because the owner of Whiz Burger can't be troubled to actually check the cars before having anyone towed, let's remember this: he had the cars of the funeral attendees towed DURING THE SERVICE.
If there was going to be a procession to the grave site, that's right out the window.
Even if there wasn't, you now have a bunch of people walking out of a funeral who now have to deal with getting their cars back.
So, 1 star for Whiz Burger.
whiz burger.author: Ben P.
whiz burger.review:
Whiz Burger's burgers and fries are okay, maybe even good.  The milkshakes are good.  The service is fair, and somewhat prompt.  The prices aren't great, but aren't horrible.  For this, the restaurant gets 3 stars.

The restaurant has one other feature, however, which I can't fail to mention.

/enable rant mode

The restaurant also rents out parking the lot behind the restaurant.  About $100/month, but also on a daily basis.  Because I live nearish to the restaurant, I rented parking there for a month.  One day, I returned to discover my car gone.  After the initial "Oh my god, someone stole my car" hysteria had passed, and after long investigation with the manager, I found out the story went this way:

Whiz Burger is near a Korean church.  There had been a funeral at that church that afternoon.  Many of the attendees had parked in the Whiz Burger lot without paying, so the owner of Whiz Burger called and had all the cars in the lot towed during the service.  Including my car, despite the prominently-displayed parking pass.

Now, before we talk about poor Ben and all the trouble I was put to because the owner of Whiz Burger can't be troubled to actually check the cars before having anyone towed, let's remember this: he had the cars of the funeral attendees towed DURING THE SERVICE.  If there was going to be a procession to the grave site, that's right out the window.  Even if there wasn't, you now have a bunch of people walking out of a funeral who now have to deal with getting their cars back.  Executive summary says: WHAT A DICK MOVE!

But back to me and my problems.  I now have to get in a dirty, stinky, cramped tow truck and ride to the tow company's beautiful headquarters in wonderful Hunter's Point, return my car and drive back home.  Why do -I- have to do this?  It's not like any of this is my fault.  But the tow company politely refused to return my car any other way.  The tow truck driver also felt the need to try to explain to me why none of this was his company's fault.  Great move!  I guess it's judgment like this that has resulted in you having a career as a tow truck driver.

I now pay $160/month to park elsewhere, but at least when I go to get my car, it's where I left it.  And, really, isn't that THE WHOLE FREAKING POINT?????

/end rant

So, 1 star for Whiz Burger.

excerpts: That being said Whiz Burger could only be more American if you installed a Statute of liberty on top of the building that played the tune to 'God bless America,' while the 1985 Bears sing and do the 'Super Bowl Shuffle'.
The design of Whiz Burger is awesomely great as it looks like a relic from a by-gone era of the 1950s when diner food actually WAS considered healthy and nutritious.
Unlike other wannabe 50's diners
*cough cough
Lori's DIner cough cough
Whiz Burger was indeed built in the 50s, and not just some lame corporate gimmick.

They actually do have salads, but lets be honest no one goes to Whiz Burgers for a salad, you go to Whiz Burger because you wanted a drippy saucy beef burger with heart-clogging mayonnaise, and salty french fries that leave you full and maybe a little disgusted by yourself.
whiz burger.author: david h.
whiz burger.review:
word,

There something to be said about diner food. Diner food really represents the true ideals of America as diner food completely disregards any idea of health or nutrition in the search of the all-American, all-pleasing taste rush. When in doubt deep-fry it. Pour that salt on that. Liquid sugar side drink? Oh you know it. Barely cooked beef? Yes, yes 1000x yes!

That being said Whiz Burger could only be more American if you installed a Statute of liberty on top of the building that played the tune to 'God bless America,' while the 1985 Bears sing and do the 'Super Bowl Shuffle'.  

The design of Whiz Burger is awesomely great as it looks like a relic from a by-gone era of the 1950s when diner food actually WAS considered healthy and nutritious. Unlike other wannabe 50's diners **cough cough Lori's DIner cough cough **** Whiz Burger was indeed built in the 50s, and not just some lame corporate gimmick. You feel like the Jets might show up to order a burger before the their rumble with the Sharks.

Like any respectable diner joint they have burgers, fries, shakes and soda. They've even modernized a little with churros and salmon burgers. They actually do have salads, but lets be honest no one goes to Whiz Burgers for a salad, you go to Whiz Burger because you wanted a drippy saucy beef burger with heart-clogging mayonnaise, and salty french fries that leave you full and maybe a little disgusted by yourself.

yups

excerpts: I really enjoyed Whiz Burger.
I can't wait to return!
Thank gawd I live 5 minutes away!
whiz burger.author: Michael M.
whiz burger.review:
After a full day of cleaning a storage room, buying a Christmas tree and doing good deeds like donating items to the Goodwill, I needed a burger. Seriously, I thought, "I need a burger." 

I ordered a double bacon (I know!) cheese burger with garlic fries. The burger I had was actually very good. I had no clue what to expect. The quality of meat was surprising, and the cheese wasn't processed American slices. I'm suspicious it was like nacho cheese. It actually tasted really good! The garlic fries were good as well, after of course, I added some seasoning. The garlic fries got the garlic part down. So well, my car filled with the smell of garlic almost instantly. I bet if they sprinkled the fries with some salt or their seasoning would have made them fantastic. 

I really enjoyed Whiz Burger. I can't wait to return! Thank gawd I live 5 minutes away!

excerpts: Everyone hears the name whiz BURGER, and they don't know that they make the second best cheese steak sandwich in the city... order the #4 (includes coke and fries)  with "hot peppers, grilled onions, and bell peppers" and you are good to go with a GREAT cheese steak.
whiz burger.author: Timotheus C.
whiz burger.review:
Everyone hears the name whiz BURGER, and they don't know that they make the second best cheese steak sandwich in the city... order the #4 (includes coke and fries)  with "hot peppers, grilled onions, and bell peppers" and you are good to go with a GREAT cheese steak.

Get the BURGER out of your head and go for the cheese steak.  I have never even had their burgers, and never will.  How could anybody eat a burger there after eating their cheese steak?  Closest to Philly besides Divisadero street a the Cheese Steak shop.

excerpts:
Me: Whiz Burger (the works), crispy fries, banana shake.
Counter Dude: Here? 
To go?
Me: Here.
Counter Dude: 5 minutes.
Me: Sweet
Counter Dude:
whiz burger.author: Dutch G.
whiz burger.review:
Dude fuck all y'all that diss the wonder of the Whiz.  Straight up.

First of all as a born and raised San Franciscan this place is OLD SCHOOL.  I remember going to the Whiz when I was little... back when the Mission was dangerous! Imagine that.

The fact of the matter is this: They don't care about you.  They don't care about your needs... unless those needs are a burger, crispy fried and the best fuckin' banana shake you ever laid your hands on.  To the cheap fuck who thought that the shakes are too much.  Been to St. Francis Fountain lately???  The banan shakes are better than that place by leaps and bounds.  They use FRESH bananas! So. Damn. Tasty.

On a trip to the Whiz the other day getting my haircut it went a little like this:

Counter Dude: What you want?
Me: Whiz Burger (the works), crispy fries, banana shake.
Counter Dude: Here? To go?
Me: Here.
Counter Dude: 5 minutes.
Me: Sweet
Counter Dude: Cool.

Done and done... no ass kissing, no "service"... it doesn't preport to be Park Chow nor DOES IT WANT TO BE!  The new peeps in San Francisco feel like every restaurant has to give them a blow job with their meal in order to get 5 stars.  That just isn't how it is.

excerpts: If I can do it at home, Whiz Burger can do it.
whiz burger.author: Natalie G.
whiz burger.review:
Great turkey burger, awful fries. Is it that hard to blanch some fries in the morning, toss them in the freezer and then give them a 3 minute fry when they're ordered so they don't come out all soggy and oil-logged? If I can do it at home, Whiz Burger can do it. 

I will prob go back someday for another turkey burger or maybe a regular cheeseburger but I won't be ordering the fries.

excerpts: I understand the need to protect your lot if you're in such a central location, but, Whiz Burger, be reasonable.
Towing loving customers' cars is not a way to keep them coming back.
Then again, if you split the fee with the tow company, I guess it's as if we'll be coming back for another 13 or so meals.
whiz burger.author: John F.
whiz burger.review:
Damn good burgers, damn good shakes -- Watch your car like a maniac.

It is not worth the $400 we ended up paying as a result of eating there. My lady friend and I parked in their lot, got a burger and shake, ate it there, and then took a little walk. When we returned about 45 mins later, the car had been towed. The only signs were the standard "unauthorized vehicles will be towed/parking for customers only." The fellow at the counter told my now sobbing friend that, yeah, tow truck comes by every 15 minutes (???). 

I understand the need to protect your lot if you're in such a central location, but, Whiz Burger, be reasonable. Towing loving customers' cars is not a way to keep them coming back. Then again, if you split the fee with the tow company, I guess it's as if we'll be coming back for another 13 or so meals.

Good fast food in a old school happy days diner.

excerpts: I had the Big Whiz burger minus the avocado.
I love avo but always find its inclusion on a burger a little odd.

The Big Whiz is obviously their signature dish and comprises of two patties, some sauce, lettuce, tomato, pickle and bacon served in a French roll and then expertly wrapped up in wax paper and sliced in two.
It was absolutely delicious, well seasoned and a great balance of flavours
and I still think that the addition of avo would have been a bridge too far.
whiz burger.author: Tony S.
whiz burger.review:
I've driven past Whiz many many times thinking ooh I must try that, it looks good.  It reminds me a little of Dick's in Seattle that has been a fixture on Broadway for many year, but this review isn't about them so apologies for the digression.

I had the Big Whiz burger minus the avocado.  I love avo but always find its inclusion on a burger a little odd.  The Big Whiz is obviously their signature dish and comprises of two patties, some sauce, lettuce, tomato, pickle and bacon served in a French roll and then expertly wrapped up in wax paper and sliced in two.  It was absolutely delicious, well seasoned and a great balance of flavours and I still think that the addition of avo would have been a bridge too far.  The use of a French roll rather than a burger bun is an inspired choice and sets the Big Whiz apart from your common garden variety burger.

The garlic fries we ordered to go with our meal were definitely garlic fries but woefully underseasoned and no salt was given to us in the bag.   I presume this was another misguided attempt to help keep my blood pressure low and if at any point in my future my doctor tells me it is anything other than textbook I'll thank the food service industry of California for doing its bit, but until then I'll keep on my high horse.

I did however think that Whiz was damned expensive for a counter service burger joint.  2 burgers and 1 portion of garlic fries came out at an eyewatering $18.  If we had added drinks each then we'd have been looking at $25.

excerpts: The only thing about Whiz Burger that isn't stuck in the 1950s is the prices.
whiz burger.author: Brian U.
whiz burger.review:
Although my mild food snobbery rarely dissuades me from trying new places, this particular one had always scared me. I'd walked by it a zillion times on my way to and from Bart, and my preconceptions of it had been dark indeed: it stood as a postapocalyptic monument to the faraway days of Eisenhower and Khrushchev; unchanged and uncleaned in its half century, it quietly harkened to the utopian nostalgia of innocent teenagers at soda shops, while simultaneously failing to fend off accumulated decades of urban blight. This looked like the sort of dilapidated drive-in where gangbangers and homeless denizens would gather today, the sort of place that might have been the initially cheerful setting for a B-grade horror flick in the '80s, only to become the site of real shootings in the '90s, and which of course would carry roachy, ebola-laced Z-grade food that could kill on sight.

Thankfully, the reality was not such a faustian tapestry. The menu on the back wall is printed in Tomorrowland-esque retro futuristic style, and includes an assortment of burgers, dawgs, fries, shakes, and (disturbingly) chicken teriyaki. Past experience has taught me wariness of eating establishments that serve burgers, burritos, *and* teriyaki -- invariably none of them will be remotely edible -- but the lack of burritos in this case allowed Whiz past my radar with only a yellow alert.

Their impressive selection of fries included regular (thin-cut), garlic (didn't try because they were $3), and seasoned (the delicious waffle kind that are near impossible to find elsewhere). I paid the extra quarter for a dollop of mediocre Ranch to dip my seasoned fries. One of my lunch companions got an involuntarily supersized order of skinny fries for dessert, which seemed only fitting after her dinosaur-shaped and very probably not organic chicken nugget entre.

Shakes there were runny and unmemorable, offered in a variety of flavors which would have been divine had they contained any real ice cream. And in the espresso shake I ordered, real espresso. Funny how so many things in life could be improved with the simple addition of espresso. Heed the wisdom of this lesson at every opportunity, Grasshopper.

As for the burger, I got a 1/4 pound "junior" cheeseburger. It was probably the closest thing to a Tommy Burger I've had in Northern California: no ingredient is of particularly high quality, yet somehow the cheapness of it all coalesces into a product that surprisingly exceeds the sum of its parts. I'd still favor an In-n-Out or Nation's burger over a Whiz, but there's something transcendently gratifying about enjoying trashy food that logic dictates should be awful. This principle actually holds together many Midwestern delicacies: green bean casserole, cherry dump cake, and jello parfait among them.

The only thing about Whiz Burger that isn't stuck in the 1950s is the prices. I shelled out $9 for the junior burger, waffle fries, and shake. Ouchitude! Sometimes the painful reality of Bay Area prices can bust the illusion of an otherwise perfectly believable anachronism.

The quantity of grease consumed over lunch would have been better spread out over a month or two; my system was generally disgruntled following the experience. But my mouth had enough guilty pleasure that I may return occasionally. And no, I won't be trying the teriyaki.

excerpts: I go to Whiz Burger.
whiz burger.author: Michael C.
whiz burger.review:
Similar story to my Serrano's review.  Minus the unrequited love.  

Consistent, good, cheep, fast, close to home.  When I need a cheeseburger fix and I am lazy or short on time.  I go to Whiz Burger.  

I don't question the quality.  Things can be good and not of high quality.  Maybe that sounds bad, but whatever, there it is.  Do you love Count Chocula?  Boo Berry?  Wonka Candy?  Taco Bell?  I am sure those things are not make from top shelf materials.  I know for a fact that the ground meat used at Taco Bell is "Grade D" and there are oats added to it.  But I still love Mexi-melts.  

I had some friends eat here once and they claimed they had poopy-pants for the next 24 hours.  I love them, but they are a little delicate, intestinally speaking.  So if you have a cast-iron stomach and like cheesy burgers, this is a great place.
