excerpts: I had a Whiz Burger without avocado and a side of onion rings.
The burger comes on a roll, which is a nice change.
She had a cheeseburger with fries.
She was very excited about the little brown bag containing her fries.
I was excited about bacon because bacon makes a cheeseburger better.
Her excitement faded during the meal.
Perhaps her burger didn't live up to her standards.
Perhaps the scent of the off-duty bike messengers at the nearby table put her off her appetite.
(But bonus SF cred points for those scoring at home!)
It's not my favorite burger in the City, and I'd probably give it 3.5 stars if I could, but if I was nearby, I'd return.
whiz burger.author: Timothy O.
whiz burger.review:
I was running errands with a friend and we were both hungry. We wanted food fast, but not fast food, if you know what I mean. My friend remembered a burger she had at a bar in SOMA, but she didn't remember that the place wasn't open yet. All was almost lost until we came across Whiz Burgers. It's old school in that you order at the counter and eat outside on rough-hewn picnic tables. It's new school in that they have veggie burgers and mango shakes.

I had a Whiz Burger without avocado and a side of onion rings. The burger comes on a roll, which is a nice change. She had a cheeseburger with fries. She was very excited about the little brown bag containing her fries. I was excited about bacon because bacon makes a cheeseburger better. Her excitement faded during the meal. Perhaps her burger didn't live up to her standards. Perhaps the scent of the off-duty bike messengers at the nearby table put her off her appetite. (But bonus SF cred points for those scoring at home!) It's not my favorite burger in the City, and I'd probably give it 3.5 stars if I could, but if I was nearby, I'd return.

excerpts: Whiz Burger is one of those places that you remember seeing in like the 1950s..
ok, maybe I wasn't alive in the 1950s
The "whiz burger" is a strange sandwich on a french roll with avocado and bacon.
I like my burger..
whiz burger.author: Dennis Y.
whiz burger.review:
Whiz Burger is one of those places that you remember seeing in like the 1950s.. ok, maybe I wasn't alive in the 1950s but you know what I mean.. 

The old, beat up, bird guano stained half broken sign proudly marks the corner of 18th and South Van Ness.  There's no indoor seating at this burger stand, so you'll have to take your food home, or eat on the oddly proportioned picnic tables that look like they were recycled from the construction site down the street.  Well, at least they're recycled.

As for the food, it's what you'd expect from a burger stand.  Fast, hot, greasy and tasty.  I prefer the burger burger myself -- it's just your classic hamburger on a sesame seed bun.  The "whiz burger" is a strange sandwich on a french roll with avocado and bacon.  I like my burger.. um.. more burger like.

The shakes are delish.. i always go for the chocolate banana...  Anyway, stop by whiz on your way to wherever.. it was one of those places that I'd always pass by and think to myself.. "Hmmm.. I should stop there".  And one day I did.  and I was happy.

excerpts: Whiz Burger is served on a hoagie roll.
The meat patty is coarsely ground.
You do not have an option for medium well, etc.
For the money ($9 for whiz burger, fries, and bottled water), I'd walk the extra few blocks to Burger Joint.
whiz burger.author: Rob T.
whiz burger.review:
Sitting outside on the picnic tables (no indoor dining) is not bad on a nice day.

The service and food are no-nonsense.

Whiz Burger is served on a hoagie roll. The meat patty is coarsely ground. You do not have an option for medium well, etc., so you may infer whatever you want to infer from that fact (e.g., unlikely to be Niman Ranch beef).

For the money ($9 for whiz burger, fries, and bottled water), I'd walk the extra few blocks to Burger Joint.

excerpts: My first time here was when the crack heads next door to my building pulled the fire alarm - I decided to whiz on to Whiz Burger with my friends instead of waiting outside for no reason.
whiz burger.author: Christina C.
whiz burger.review:
Oh it's good.. trust me. My first time here was when the crack heads next door to my building pulled the fire alarm - I decided to whiz on to Whiz Burger with my friends instead of waiting outside for no reason.  

Since then, I've had the turkey burger and veggie burger ... all great!  I have a weakness for french fries so I never go without.  Their regular fries are a good intermediate between skinny fries and fat fries.  They also make seasoned cris-cut fries which are awesome.  

Always nice to take it togo with some beers and head to Dolores Park if you're tired of eating burritos in the Mission.  They also open late 9:45-10pm everyday.  Score!

excerpts:
I had a Whiz Burger w/out bacon, seasoned Waffle Fries with some amazing ranch on the side, and a tastetastic Banana Shake ---   

Everything was just right & exactly what I needed at 9:30pm... toasted bun, fresh lettuce/tomato, and WAFFLE FRIES.
whiz burger.author: Jake B.
whiz burger.review:
I have lived here for almost 2yrs now, and this place caught my eye the 1st week I was in SF... and I had never been there until yesterday!

This place is so freaking good, it actually rivals my out-of-state affection for In&Out Burger.  I had a Whiz Burger w/out bacon, seasoned Waffle Fries with some amazing ranch on the side, and a tastetastic Banana Shake ---   

Everything was just right & exactly what I needed at 9:30pm... toasted bun, fresh lettuce/tomato, and WAFFLE FRIES. I do love the animal meat, and this place serves it up real good.   If you haven't been here, do it now.  I mean, right now.

(Fear not Veggies, they do have Veggie Burgers also.)

excerpts: If you just get a craving for grilled meat in a bun like I do from time to time, definitely check out THE whiz burger--two patties in a French roll, with avocado and bacon, for $6.75, little more with cheese.
Their shakes are also money.
whiz burger.author: Alan R.
whiz burger.review: Whiz was something of a dinner staple of mine when I lived closer to this place.  Some might say it appears grungy, and you must sit outside (or take your food elsewhere), but it's also got ample parking and a unique building that gives it character.  Their fare is classic American diner food, and it doesn't disappoint, for the price especially.  If you just get a craving for grilled meat in a bun like I do from time to time, definitely check out THE whiz burger--two patties in a French roll, with avocado and bacon, for $6.75, little more with cheese.  Their shakes are also money.

excerpts: Whiz Burger is a great walk-up burger joint in the Mission.
As to be expected, that day came sooner than later, and I found myself ordering a cheeseburger, Whiz Burger, waffle fries, and a hot dog.
Yeah, so what...
.  Thick with nostalgia and calories, if Whiz Burger doesn't fix you up when you're feeling down for some comfort food...
whiz burger.author: Mark M.
whiz burger.review:
Whiz Burger is a great walk-up burger joint in the Mission.  I spied it while driving up S. Van Ness and made a mental note to visit on a weekend when a greasy burger is the preferred remedy for a hangover.

As to be expected, that day came sooner than later, and I found myself ordering a cheeseburger, Whiz Burger, waffle fries, and a hot dog.  Yeah, so what...I was hung over and grease does a body good (sometimes).  

These burgers harkened back to the good ol' days:  when guys put the same oil in their hair that they did in their V-8s.  Thick with nostalgia and calories, if Whiz Burger doesn't fix you up when you're feeling down for some comfort food...then I doubt anything will.  

This place isn't tidy and doesn't want to be either.  Sun beaten posters and food advertisements are taped everywhere you look, but the service is prompt.  You may have to share a table with a pigeon or two, but if you can find an outdoor greasy spoon without that kind of clientele, let me know.  

Great food for someone who had an, ahem, great weekend!

excerpts: I very much enjoy Whiz Burger and would subscribe to their newsletter.
whiz burger.author: Joshua S.
whiz burger.review: Wildwood tofu burgers as the standard veggie burger is an A+ choice.  The "Seasoned Fries" are waffle fries, the normal fries are thick, and the garlic fries are better left un-ordered.  I very much enjoy Whiz Burger and would subscribe to their newsletter.

excerpts: I love Whiz Burger.
Do not come here for gourmet.
Come here because the burgers are solid, the fries are crisp, and the urge commands.
They even have a parking lot, so bring your disastrous carbon footprint.
whiz burger.author: Allison L.
whiz burger.review: I love Whiz Burger. Do not come here for gourmet. Come here because the burgers are solid, the fries are crisp, and the urge commands. They even have a parking lot, so bring your disastrous carbon footprint.

excerpts: I love Whiz Burger.
The vegie burgers are good especially with grilled onions.
The fries and onion rings are usually good although occasionally they overcook them, but that doesn't happen often.
They always get my order correct, which I truly appreciate.
And they have a parking lot.
What's not to love?
whiz burger.author: Wan T.
whiz burger.review: I love Whiz Burger. The vegie burgers are good especially with grilled onions. The fries and onion rings are usually good although occasionally they overcook them, but that doesn't happen often. They always get my order correct, which I truly appreciate. And they have a parking lot. What's not to love?

excerpts: our neighbor sherman used to own whiz burger until he died in the early 90s.
the first time i ever saw this place was maybe around 1987 when my dad left me in the car on 18th st.
to go do something shady
the key things that differentiate a whiz burger are the long soft-roll like bun, and automatic bacon and avacado.

whiz burger i would classify as a 2nd tier chinese hamburger, i dont normally compare chinese hamburgers in the same class of food-item as regular hamburgers such as 1st tier burgers like pearls burgers and joe's cable car or 2nd tier burgers like zeitgeist, barneys and big mouth burgers.
whiz burger.author: christopher a.
whiz burger.review:
our neighbor sherman used to own whiz burger until he died in the early 90s.  the first time i ever saw this place was maybe around 1987 when my dad left me in the car on 18th st. to go do something shady im sure.

the key things that differentiate a whiz burger are the long soft-roll like bun, and automatic bacon and avacado.  whiz burger i would classify as a 2nd tier chinese hamburger, i dont normally compare chinese hamburgers in the same class of food-item as regular hamburgers such as 1st tier burgers like pearls burgers and joe's cable car or 2nd tier burgers like zeitgeist, barneys and big mouth burgers.

excerpts: personally, i think whiz burger has the best veggie burger in the city.
it comes with all the fixin's and it's a wildwood tofu burger which is the cream of the crop as far as veggie burgers are concerned.
they put lots of pickles on your veggie burger which i like
and it's best with cheese and avocado.
one thing is that they don't put ketchup on your burger, you have to add that yourself.
whiz burger.author: Kristie P.
whiz burger.review:
personally, i think whiz burger has the best veggie burger in the city.  it comes with all the fixin's and it's a wildwood tofu burger which is the cream of the crop as far as veggie burgers are concerned.  they put lots of pickles on your veggie burger which i like and it's best with cheese and avocado.  one thing is that they don't put ketchup on your burger, you have to add that yourself. and, if you get it to go on a regular basis you'll end up with a drawer full of ketchup packets.

you have to get a shake if you go!  they're all good but the fresh banana shake is the best.

i would give whiz 5 stars but sometimes their french fries are less than stellar.  usually i think they are good and crispy but every now and then i get a bad batch.

excerpts: The Whiz Burger (burger with lots of mayo, bacon, avocado, and other forms of animal and vegetable fat) is served on a french roll.
It's retardedly delicious.
whiz burger.author: Michael M.
whiz burger.review: The Whiz Burger (burger with lots of mayo, bacon, avocado, and other forms of animal and vegetable fat) is served on a french roll.  It's retardedly delicious.

excerpts: Screw 40 virgins, just give me a banana shake and a whiz burger with a small order of fries.
whiz burger.author: Mark P.
whiz burger.review: I like to issue fatwa's with Shaketada al Fryphy at the Church of Whizzlam.  Screw 40 virgins, just give me a banana shake and a whiz burger with a small order of fries.

excerpts: Ahhh Whiz Burger, definitely a destination spot for my wife and I on a Sunday afernoon.
My wife gets the whiz Burger and I always opt for the veggie burger with fries.
You hear the term "old school" over and over when people describe this place.
I'll agree, the ambiance and old -never refurbished chairs and counter tops give you the old school feel, but its more like a run down memory of the way things used to be.
I like the food
but I think the name WHIZ burger is very appropriate as we almost always smell urine while we are eating.
Its fun to go on a Sunday afternoon because the church across the street lets out around 1pm and you can spot some really awful church outfits.
You have to love a church with a hotdog vendor outside!
All in all, Whizburger is a great place to soak up Saturday nights hangover and move on quickly before the smell of piss ruins your appetite.
whiz burger.author: Go Cat Go G.
whiz burger.review: Ahhh Whiz Burger, definitely a destination spot for my wife and I on a Sunday afernoon. My wife gets the whiz Burger and I always opt for the veggie burger with fries. You hear the term "old school" over and over when people describe this place. I'll agree, the ambiance and old -never refurbished chairs and counter tops give you the old school feel, but its more like a run down memory of the way things used to be. I like the food but I think the name WHIZ burger is very appropriate as we almost always smell urine while we are eating. Its fun to go on a Sunday afternoon because the church across the street lets out around 1pm and you can spot some really awful church outfits. You have to love a church with a hotdog vendor outside! All in all, Whizburger is a great place to soak up Saturday nights hangover and move on quickly before the smell of piss ruins your appetite.

excerpts: After all, the irresistible Whiz Burger (served on a french roll, with bacon AND avocado and the usual burger makings, then neatly wrapped and cut in half even though gluttons like me will just consume the whole thing in one sitting).
whiz burger.author: ray e.
whiz burger.review: it's another "WTF? I haven't reviewed Whiz Burgers?! How could that be?" After all, the irresistible Whiz Burger (served on a french roll, with bacon AND avocado and the usual burger makings, then neatly wrapped and cut in half even though gluttons like me will just consume the whole thing in one sitting). the cross cut fries are crispety crunchety good, so are the shake offerings (hmmmmm... mango shake) AND they have corn dogs. There was a time that I craved WB but got dissuaded by my friends and went to a vegan place instead. THAT was a mistake. I was depressed for days, only to be cured by the tasty goodness housed on the corner that WB occupies.

excerpts: whiz burger is a decent if i'm looking for a cheap lunch place to satify that carving for a burger or hot link with fries & washing it down with a shake.
the burgers are overall decent nothing to majorly rave about.
the hot link sandwich is pretty good, sliced in half down the middle served on a seeded roll with the standard fixins.
the fries are pretty good when they are hot.
whiz burger.author: larry s.
whiz burger.review:
whiz burger is a decent if i'm looking for a cheap lunch place to satify that carving for a burger or hot link with fries & washing it down with a shake.  the burgers are overall decent nothing to majorly rave about.  the hot link sandwich is pretty good, sliced in half down the middle served on a seeded roll with the standard fixins.  the fries are pretty good when they are hot.  the milk shakes are the best though.

not a bad place to pick up a quick bite to eat or just craving greasy spoon burger.  the prices are pretty reasonable for what you are getting.  parking is available either on the street on in their parking lot.  they only accept cash.

excerpts: The Whiz Burger is my absolute favorite, why?
It has bacon and avocado without paying the extra price to add them on.
Their quick, sometimes friendly and that's why you'll see me here grabing a bite to eat.
whiz burger.author: Lucky M.
whiz burger.review: Since this place is a hop and a skip from my condo, i had to try it. My roommate told me to not to try it since its in the mission district and on the corner where all the crazy people hang late at night. That didn't stop me from trying the place out and i'm happy i did! OMG they have Garlic fries! Not the powder mixture but real garlic and parsley garlic fries. My love for garlic fries is beyond anything, anywhere they sell garlic fries I'm there! Their burgers are good as hell, its not your regular shaped burgers but I don't expect everything to be normal in the mission. The Whiz Burger is my absolute favorite, why? It has bacon and avocado without paying the extra price to add them on. Their quick, sometimes friendly and that's why you'll see me here grabing a bite to eat.

excerpts: They have a unique veggie burger, but I always go for the Whiz Burger, criss-cut fries, and a root beer freeze (it's like a root beer milkshake).
Being at 18th and SVN don't be alarmed if you find yourself amongst crackheads, junkies, and hookers.
whiz burger.author: Josiah B.
whiz burger.review: The Whiz... Best drive-up 50's style burger joint in the city!  They have a unique veggie burger, but I always go for the Whiz Burger, criss-cut fries, and a root beer freeze (it's like a root beer milkshake).  Being at 18th and SVN don't be alarmed if you find yourself amongst crackheads, junkies, and hookers.

excerpts:
so, basically 95% of my friends live within a 10-block radius of whiz burger, while i live in the cuts of the richmond, so i spend a lot of time driving back and forth across the city, making eating sometimes precarious...

but wait!
have no fear, whiz burger to the rescue!
seeing that it was still open and i hadn't eaten in a while (making me cranky like woah), i pulled into their parking lot (yay!
not everyone is a hipster on a bike!)
and was thrilled to see that they had chicken, turkey and veggie burgers all as menu items!
i have not eaten red meat since i was a kid, and i don't plan to start anytime soon, so this was a good bonus.
and their fries are so yum!
i had them in my car when i picked up a friend, and we both could not stop eating them.
they are well-seasoned and just crispy enough to not be gross and soggy.
i also had a turkey burger which was a little over-cooked but still good
whiz burger.author: Elizabeth O.
whiz burger.review:
so, basically 95% of my friends live within a 10-block radius of whiz burger, while i live in the cuts of the richmond, so i spend a lot of time driving back and forth across the city, making eating sometimes precarious...

but wait! have no fear, whiz burger to the rescue! seeing that it was still open and i hadn't eaten in a while (making me cranky like woah), i pulled into their parking lot (yay! not everyone is a hipster on a bike!) and was thrilled to see that they had chicken, turkey and veggie burgers all as menu items! i have not eaten red meat since i was a kid, and i don't plan to start anytime soon, so this was a good bonus. and their fries are so yum! i had them in my car when i picked up a friend, and we both could not stop eating them. they are well-seasoned and just crispy enough to not be gross and soggy. i also had a turkey burger which was a little over-cooked but still good and really this is a totally legit quick-bite.

and having had their fries, i'm really grateful i don't live closer...

excerpts: how can you not love Whiz Burger.
old school all the way.
the guy was nice and didn't catch me doing the video...
whiz burger.author: Veronica V.
whiz burger.review: got a sandwich of some kind here and took this little video of one of my favorite signs in the city.  how can you not love Whiz Burger. old school all the way.  the guy was nice and didn't catch me doing the video...

excerpts: I ordered the 1/4 lb junior burger with fries and a banana milkshake.
Price wasn't bad at 12.75.
junior burger.author: Zoe L.
junior burger.review:
Went here twice recently (both Oct 2018) and got food poisoning / diarrhea the second time. I know, so unlucky. I hate giving bad reviews, especially to places that are neighborhood institutions, so soon after moving to the mission. But they haven't even claimed their yelp page yet, after so many years of being in business, so I can only conclude they don't really care. 

The food sure tasted good but I can't overlook the diarrhea I'm now dealing with which has kept me up half the night. To me it signals that something isn't quite right with their food preparation methods.

I ordered the 1/4 lb junior burger with fries and a banana milkshake. Price wasn't bad at 12.75. Pay cash! 

Come here at your peril! You may be ripped off with weird credit card stuff, have your car towed or spend half the night sitting on the crapper.

excerpts: I ordered the junior burger combo with garlic fries & my boyfriend ordered the bacon burger combo with crisscut fries.
It was all super good!
And they definitely overhand the fries, which was rad.
The ranch was tasty (we're really picky about our ranch haha).
junior burger.author: Mika C.
junior burger.review:
Support small local businesses! :-)
My boyfriend and I were looking for a quick burger place to go to and came across Whiz Burgers on Yelp. We got good vibes all around from the place, the employee who took our order, as well as the other customers eating. I ordered the junior burger combo with garlic fries & my boyfriend ordered the bacon burger combo with crisscut fries. It was all super good! And they definitely overhand the fries, which was rad. The ranch was tasty (we're really picky about our ranch haha).

excerpts: The junior burger was substantial enough for me, but don't let stop you from gorging yourself on a full-sized burg or a chili dog or what have you.
They have veggie options, a turkey burger, and fish burger too.
junior burger.author: Vivek S.
junior burger.review:
A shining beacon of hope on the promenade of despair that is South Van Ness. If you want cheap and tasty burgers, dogs, fries, shakes and other morsels of Americana, this is your spot. A combo with fries and a drink is under $8, and only takes a few minutes to cook up. You can easily fill your stomach for under a ten-spot.

Note that this isn't a dine-in kind of place. It's a walkup window with a few picnic benches around. The view isn't great, but the eats are very good.

The junior burger was substantial enough for me, but don't let stop you from gorging yourself on a full-sized burg or a chili dog or what have you. They have veggie options, a turkey burger, and fish burger too. But obviously the truly health conscious should walk on by.

Me and the Dining Companion opted for onion rings and cross-cut fries instead of the regular old befrenched fries. You can do it too. Be the change you want to see in your potato world.

Obligatory Title Pun: Don't WHIZ past this gem.

Menu Readability: Check out the handpainted sign inside!

Need to mention: They have a perfect health score. And they accept cards.

What this place teaches me about myself: I really shouldn't paraphrase Gandhi in this context.

excerpts: I ordered my junior burger meal deal, aka #1, and sat down to watch the show.
A random sampling of who might appear - a pimp, the homeless, the hipsters, the business person, but somehow it all works.
It's loud, the buses stop out front, it's grimy, but damn it makes me smile every time.
junior burger.author: Shannon K.
junior burger.review:
Oh Whiz, you gritty little Mission delight. I completely agree with the overall 3.5 star rating. There is just something so quintessential San Franciscan about this corner dive. While you will never see a tourist stop here (bless the heavens), I also don't think we will ever see Guy Fieri or Anthony Bourdain featuring the joint, but I adore it.

I ordered my junior burger meal deal, aka #1, and sat down to watch the show. A random sampling of who might appear - a pimp, the homeless, the hipsters, the business person, but somehow it all works. It's loud, the buses stop out front, it's grimy, but damn it makes me smile every time. It sings San Francisco! 

I enjoy the burgers, the chicken sandwich and the turkey burgers. The fries are thick cut and cooked perfectly. It's not the best burger around, but there is just something delightful about the whole experience. The burger reminds me of grilling out at my parents' house on a hot summer day. The burger is a little more done than I like, the bun is not completely fresh, the shredded lettuce is a tad watery, but I swear to you it is so damn good! The mustard and mayo combines and creates this creamy, tangy sauce that clings to the lettuce shreds and adds a certain dimension of flavor. 

I would never dream of taking an out-of-towner here, but if you live or work in the city then I believe it is a must-experience experience! It just works and it's just so good! Check it out, fo' sho'.

excerpts: I shelled out $9 for the junior burger, waffle fries, and shake.
Ouchitude!
junior burger.author: Brian U.
junior burger.review:
Although my mild food snobbery rarely dissuades me from trying new places, this particular one had always scared me. I'd walked by it a zillion times on my way to and from Bart, and my preconceptions of it had been dark indeed: it stood as a postapocalyptic monument to the faraway days of Eisenhower and Khrushchev; unchanged and uncleaned in its half century, it quietly harkened to the utopian nostalgia of innocent teenagers at soda shops, while simultaneously failing to fend off accumulated decades of urban blight. This looked like the sort of dilapidated drive-in where gangbangers and homeless denizens would gather today, the sort of place that might have been the initially cheerful setting for a B-grade horror flick in the '80s, only to become the site of real shootings in the '90s, and which of course would carry roachy, ebola-laced Z-grade food that could kill on sight.

Thankfully, the reality was not such a faustian tapestry. The menu on the back wall is printed in Tomorrowland-esque retro futuristic style, and includes an assortment of burgers, dawgs, fries, shakes, and (disturbingly) chicken teriyaki. Past experience has taught me wariness of eating establishments that serve burgers, burritos, *and* teriyaki -- invariably none of them will be remotely edible -- but the lack of burritos in this case allowed Whiz past my radar with only a yellow alert.

Their impressive selection of fries included regular (thin-cut), garlic (didn't try because they were $3), and seasoned (the delicious waffle kind that are near impossible to find elsewhere). I paid the extra quarter for a dollop of mediocre Ranch to dip my seasoned fries. One of my lunch companions got an involuntarily supersized order of skinny fries for dessert, which seemed only fitting after her dinosaur-shaped and very probably not organic chicken nugget entre.

Shakes there were runny and unmemorable, offered in a variety of flavors which would have been divine had they contained any real ice cream. And in the espresso shake I ordered, real espresso. Funny how so many things in life could be improved with the simple addition of espresso. Heed the wisdom of this lesson at every opportunity, Grasshopper.

As for the burger, I got a 1/4 pound "junior" cheeseburger. It was probably the closest thing to a Tommy Burger I've had in Northern California: no ingredient is of particularly high quality, yet somehow the cheapness of it all coalesces into a product that surprisingly exceeds the sum of its parts. I'd still favor an In-n-Out or Nation's burger over a Whiz, but there's something transcendently gratifying about enjoying trashy food that logic dictates should be awful. This principle actually holds together many Midwestern delicacies: green bean casserole, cherry dump cake, and jello parfait among them.

The only thing about Whiz Burger that isn't stuck in the 1950s is the prices. I shelled out $9 for the junior burger, waffle fries, and shake. Ouchitude! Sometimes the painful reality of Bay Area prices can bust the illusion of an otherwise perfectly believable anachronism.

The quantity of grease consumed over lunch would have been better spread out over a month or two; my system was generally disgruntled following the experience. But my mouth had enough guilty pleasure that I may return occasionally. And no, I won't be trying the teriyaki.

excerpts: Order the junior burger with extra pickles, ketchup and mustard only.
Accompany that with a small order of  fries.
junior burger.author: marc d.
junior burger.review:
Frozen in the 80s blue-collar era of this city now all but disappeared, this place is no nonsense and the real deal.  As I type this review my keyboard is starting to glisten with the glow of french fry grease and twinkling salt.  

Order the junior burger with extra pickles, ketchup and mustard only.  Accompany that with a small order of  fries.  Sit outside at the bar and hum "God Bless America" as you gorge yourself.  

PS - I ordered this today for lunch and my total came to $6.66.

excerpts: I got the burger burger, which I was told was basically the Whiz burger without avocado and bacon.
The meat was almost like highschool lunch burger mystery meat, on par with McDonalds.
burger burger.author: Skye W.
burger burger.review:
Props for being here since 1955!

I got the burger burger, which I was told was basically the Whiz burger without avocado and bacon.  The meat was almost like highschool lunch burger mystery meat, on par with McDonalds.  Luckily it came with pickles and enough mustard to mask the taste.  

I stopped by while walking my dog (there aren't many places that you can grab food with a dog, well a large dog).  I wanted to sit outside and eat, but seriously there were too many homeless people and my dog was scared.

I heard their shakes are amazing- too bad I'm lactose intolerant. 

Cool that it's still around, but run down, and almost gross

excerpts: Second, the burger burger is freaking delicious.
burger burger.author: E M.
burger burger.review:
First, the place is really cool because of location and architecture.  Granted it is a drive in but there aren't many other unique places like this in the city.

Second, the burger burger is freaking delicious.  Sesame bun toasted right, fresh vegetables, good burger meat and cooked right.

Third, the fries have a taste of fries.  Other places burn the fries and they are just crisped shells of what a fry should be.  It also comes in a little bag so you don't lose them all over the place.  

Fourth, it's affordable.  If you try burger urge in the haight, the same meal of fries, burger, and beverage is $18.  It's $8 here.

excerpts: I ordered the mushroom burger and garlic fries, my friend ordered the burger burger.
While we waited, we sat on the wooden tables and chairs.
burger burger.author: Sophia G.
burger burger.review:
Came by with a friend to eat burgers. 

I ordered the mushroom burger and garlic fries, my friend ordered the burger burger. While we waited, we sat on the wooden tables and chairs. They seemed pretty dirty. 

The food took like 15 minutes to make. 

The garlic fries were pretty good, I wish they could've added a little more garlic. The burger was just dull, flat and boring. NO FLAVOR in the cheese, beef, mushrooms. 

If I'm in the area and craving garlic fries, I'll give it a second chance and check out other things in the menu too.

excerpts: The redundant "Burger Burger" is actually a single, reasonable burger.
burger burger.author: Milk N.
burger burger.review:
Don't mistake this four star review for tacit approval. This is a disgusting, borderline hazardous hell hole. Even the food items I'm comfortable consuming I can't vouch for entirely. You have to embrace the concept of beneficial stress to really get behind ordering food here. Actually dining at the outside tables would be taking things past bravado and on down into "cry for help" behavior. Eating your food at the bar stools with your back to Van Ness is up there with bending over for soap in jail or taking pills you find on the ground (both of which have more than a tangential relationship with Whiz Burger as a whole). 

With that said, I really really like the titular Whiz Burger. The right amount of everything; cheese, beef, bacon, and avocado in proportionate moderation, cooling tomato, iceberg lettuce, onion, condiments on a nice, soft, toasted roll. The redundant "Burger Burger" is actually a single, reasonable burger. I won't belabor the rest, it's all what you'd expect. 

Take a walk on the wild side but eat it at home and keep your guard up while waiting like Inspector Cleaseu coming home to Kato (i.e. calm, friendly but prepared to defend yourself).

excerpts: I prefer the burger burger myself -- it's just your classic hamburger on a sesame seed bun.
burger burger.author: Dennis Y.
burger burger.review:
Whiz Burger is one of those places that you remember seeing in like the 1950s.. ok, maybe I wasn't alive in the 1950s but you know what I mean.. 

The old, beat up, bird guano stained half broken sign proudly marks the corner of 18th and South Van Ness.  There's no indoor seating at this burger stand, so you'll have to take your food home, or eat on the oddly proportioned picnic tables that look like they were recycled from the construction site down the street.  Well, at least they're recycled.

As for the food, it's what you'd expect from a burger stand.  Fast, hot, greasy and tasty.  I prefer the burger burger myself -- it's just your classic hamburger on a sesame seed bun.  The "whiz burger" is a strange sandwich on a french roll with avocado and bacon.  I like my burger.. um.. more burger like.

The shakes are delish.. i always go for the chocolate banana...  Anyway, stop by whiz on your way to wherever.. it was one of those places that I'd always pass by and think to myself.. "Hmmm.. I should stop there".  And one day I did.  and I was happy.

excerpts: I've been searching for a good "side of the road" burger stand here in the city...not the "gourmet trying to be more than a burger burger".
So when I saw Whiz, I got all excited that maybe I'll get a sloppy burger wrapped in shiny foil with shredded lettuce, pickles and special burger sauce.
Unfortunately, this wasn't the place.
Though the burger wasn't bad (a little on the dry side), it was far from a burger stand burger.
And the price was a little high for a burger stand too.
burger burger.author: Jeremy C.
burger burger.review:
I've been searching for a good "side of the road" burger stand here in the city...not the "gourmet trying to be more than a burger burger". So when I saw Whiz, I got all excited that maybe I'll get a sloppy burger wrapped in shiny foil with shredded lettuce, pickles and special burger sauce. Unfortunately, this wasn't the place. Though the burger wasn't bad (a little on the dry side), it was far from a burger stand burger. And the price was a little high for a burger stand too. I'll have to say that the shakes were pretty good. 

I guess when a burger place also serves chicken teryaki, you take a gamble.

excerpts: Ordered a mushroom burger, onion rings, espresso shake.
Order totalled $17.34!
I could have eaten at Hodad's for that
so the food better be worth it, right?
Fell short in flavor, but the food was cooked perfectly and fresh.
Not sure I will want to visit here again, as it was just too expensive for a guy who's been spoiled by Nation's, Junkyard, Yak's and Hodad's for the same price.

The outdoor seating leaves little to be desired with the homeless always nearby, begging, but there was a parking lot on the property which makes this place easy to get in/out of as this place does not have a drive thru as the name may otherwise insinuate.
mushroom burger.author: Bill R.
mushroom burger.review: Ordered a mushroom burger, onion rings, espresso shake. Order totalled $17.34! I could have eaten at Hodad's for that so the food better be worth it, right? Fell short in flavor, but the food was cooked perfectly and fresh. Not sure I will want to visit here again, as it was just too expensive for a guy who's been spoiled by Nation's, Junkyard, Yak's and Hodad's for the same price. The outdoor seating leaves little to be desired with the homeless always nearby, begging, but there was a parking lot on the property which makes this place easy to get in/out of as this place does not have a drive thru as the name may otherwise insinuate.

excerpts: I ordered the mushroom burger and garlic fries, my friend ordered the burger burger.
While we waited, we sat on the wooden tables and chairs.
mushroom burger.author: Sophia G.
mushroom burger.review:
Came by with a friend to eat burgers. 

I ordered the mushroom burger and garlic fries, my friend ordered the burger burger. While we waited, we sat on the wooden tables and chairs. They seemed pretty dirty. 

The food took like 15 minutes to make. 

The garlic fries were pretty good, I wish they could've added a little more garlic. The burger was just dull, flat and boring. NO FLAVOR in the cheese, beef, mushrooms. 

If I'm in the area and craving garlic fries, I'll give it a second chance and check out other things in the menu too.

excerpts: The turkey burger was tasty albeit a bit dry and my buddy's mushroom burger was delectable....
just a guess
but she demolished it.
I'd recommend the seasoned waffle fries...just like the cafeteria lady used to make em...crisp on the outside and soft on the inside...the way a perfect fry should be.
Tip: Take it to go as bums tend to pester you while you are busy stuffing your face on the picnic benches outside.
mushroom burger.author: Stacy T.
mushroom burger.review:
Good amount of fixins which is key to any good burger. They give you a mound of lettuce, tomato, and pickles. The only thing that bummed me out was that they put mayo on their burgers. Yuck. 
The turkey burger was tasty albeit a bit dry and my buddy's mushroom burger was delectable....just a guess but she demolished it. I'd recommend the seasoned waffle fries...just like the cafeteria lady used to make em...crisp on the outside and soft on the inside...the way a perfect fry should be. 
Tip: Take it to go as bums tend to pester you while you are busy stuffing your face on the picnic benches outside.

excerpts: The bf had a chicken burger which he said taste "meeeeh" so i took one star off.
chicken burger.author: Cassie S.
chicken burger.review: This place what actually good. I had the Philly Cheese Steak. The meat was pretty tasty & made perfect down to the delicious local swiss cheese. Really yummy I also shared some of the chicken wings; they were deeeeply fried and I say deeeeply because I do mean it. Tasty but oily. The bf had a chicken burger which he said taste "meeeeh" so i took one star off.

excerpts: *also, currently on keto, and when I asked for "a bacon burger with everything
bacon burger.author: Nick S.
bacon burger.review:
4 stars for being practical(!) in a neighborhood where lines often exceed 30 minutes for what should be basic grub. So glad I didn't have to pine away-- ruminating over the nature of  hunger and the whims of human desire--to get this burger.

*also, currently on keto, and when I asked for "a bacon burger with everything but the bun"--I got a solid protein style burger with plenty of lettuce, tomato, etc. 

A bit rough around the edges, but they deliver the goods.

excerpts: I ordered the junior burger combo with garlic fries & my boyfriend ordered the bacon burger combo with crisscut fries.
It was all super good!
And they definitely overhand the fries, which was rad.
The ranch was tasty (we're really picky about our ranch haha).
bacon burger.author: Mika C.
bacon burger.review:
Support small local businesses! :-)
My boyfriend and I were looking for a quick burger place to go to and came across Whiz Burgers on Yelp. We got good vibes all around from the place, the employee who took our order, as well as the other customers eating. I ordered the junior burger combo with garlic fries & my boyfriend ordered the bacon burger combo with crisscut fries. It was all super good! And they definitely overhand the fries, which was rad. The ranch was tasty (we're really picky about our ranch haha).

excerpts: Had their bacon burger, criss-cut fries, and a banana milkshake.
The fries were great, the bacon burger is distinctive (though could be a little more so), and the milkshake is as good as you'd expect.
I may choose this place over In-n-Out if I were somehow put in that awkward position.
bacon burger.author: Epicurean _.
bacon burger.review: Had their bacon burger, criss-cut fries, and a banana milkshake. The fries were great, the bacon burger is distinctive (though could be a little more so), and the milkshake is as good as you'd expect. I may choose this place over In-n-Out if I were somehow put in that awkward position.

excerpts: Corn dog was properly fried and delicious.
Solid milkshake...the place is open air in a so-so part of town so keep an eye out for panhandlers.
Don't expect anything fancy from this place other than good food.
I'm surprised people are complaining about the neighborhood or the service, seriously, what did you expect??
corn dog.author: Yadira A.
corn dog.review: Finally made it to this place and it was glorious!  I know it's a burger joint but I have no power over my order if there are hotdogs or corn dogs on the menu...and that's what I got.  They slice the dog in half and serve it on a hoagie-ish bun which was great, sat flat, no spills, awesomely spicy.  Corn dog was properly fried and delicious.  Solid milkshake...the place is open air in a so-so part of town so keep an eye out for panhandlers.  Don't expect anything fancy from this place other than good food.  I'm surprised people are complaining about the neighborhood or the service, seriously, what did you expect??

Waffle fries are bomb
$2 corn dog... yes!
Banana shake is awesome
Burgers are OK, but
what the heck, it's convenient

excerpts: Possibly the best corn dog in town too.
corn dog.author: John W.
corn dog.review: Good ole fashioned drive up.  Good quality food.   Possibly the best corn dog in town too.

excerpts: Corn dog: number one (
corn dog.author: Evan W.
corn dog.review:
Burger: just meh.
Banana milkshake: it brings all the boys to the yard.
Fries: number one.
Corn dog: number one (how can you mess this up anyways?).

Minus half a star for the crooked bench table top and low quality corn syrup ketchup.

excerpts: Got the corn dog, it was average but I devoured it because I was starving.
However, the wait was super long for a corn dog!
The crowd was mixed, family members, young chic couples, but also very colorful and sketch figures.
Would love to see the picnic tables, counters, and the windows cleaned or revamped and painted or something.

corn dog.review: Got the corn dog, it was average but I devoured it because I was starving. However, the wait was super long for a corn dog! The crowd was mixed, family members, young chic couples, but also very colorful and sketch figures. Would love to see the picnic tables, counters, and the windows cleaned or revamped and painted or something.

excerpts: I went with the chicken wings and fries combo because fried meat and potatoes is one of the greatest food combinations ever invented.
The wings were tender but tiny, so if you're hungry do not go for just 7, which I thought would be enough.
chicken wings and fries.author: Josephine L.
chicken wings and fries.review:
The place screams SKETCHY with a capital "SK", but the food itself isn't so bad and the prices sure are cheap. My boyfriend is a good ol' American guy who loves his red meat, and his craving for burgers and other greasy, unhealthy American goodies brought us here one balmy summer night.

I went with the chicken wings and fries combo because fried meat and potatoes is one of the greatest food combinations ever invented. The wings were tender but tiny, so if you're hungry do not go for just 7, which I thought would be enough. The batter was nice and salty, but lacked other seasoning so came across as kind of bland. 

My boyfriend got the Whiz Burger, which comes with avocado. It was deeeeelicious and actually had me wishing I'd ordered that instead. He also got a banana shake. I'm not really into shakes and the banana shake had too much artificial banana flavoring for my liking, but it probably wouldn't be so bad for fans of banana-flavored dairy.

It's probably best not to come here alone unless you're 6.5" and built like a rock. However, the sketchy-looking people generally don't bother you. They might leer at you for a while, but then they usually find some other moving object to leer at.

excerpts: the malted shake I had was amazing and the retro look is intriguing.
malted shake.author: Jesse R.
malted shake.review:
The steak sandwich is probably just 3 stars. It's tasty and works well with the toppings they put on it, but it's nothing special... Kal's Bar-B-Q in Sunnyvale is a lot better in that regard. But I can't give this place 3 stars as a whole... the malted shake I had was amazing and the retro look is intriguing.

It's a bit awkward having to sit at a picnic table in the Mission District when you go here... I imagine a lot of the patrons opt to get their food to go rather than eating at one of the few tables they have outside.

Overall, I plan to return again and try a burger. I'll consider the steak sandwich as well, but I'd like to try more things here.

excerpts: * Fresh Banana Shake ($4.70) - 4 stars
Usually I avoid banana in any smoothie I get as I feel it's overpowering, but here it tasted great!
fresh banana shake.author: Ziyan C.
fresh banana shake.review:
High 3 stars. We walk by Whiz Burgers all the time and have always been curious - are they any good? How do they stay in business? (They always seem empty)

Turns out they have pretty good burgers. Still unclear how they are still around, but turns out they are pretty historic and used to be a legit drive through (turned parking lot. Maybe that's how they stay afloat nowadays). 

On top of the decent burger, there's also no wait, it's cheap, and they have a great banana shake. It's worth a stop by here to try it out!

THE FOOD:

* Garlic Fries ($4.95) - 2.5 stars
The fries, while thick cut (which I like), were too dry. Also, this smelled strongly of garlic, but when we opened it, it looked like plain fries. Where was the garlic? We could taste it, but not as strongly as when the fries are covered with freshly chopped garlic. 

* Fresh Banana Shake ($4.70) - 4 stars
Usually I avoid banana in any smoothie I get as I feel it's overpowering, but here it tasted great! Made fresh, nice thick texture.

* Whiz Burger ($8.75) - 3.5 stars
Good! This is the only burger that comes on a French Roll, which while more classy, makes for a drier/crunchier bread. Otherwise the ingredients are fresh, and they are nicely balanced. For the patty, I asked for "medium rare" and I think the guy chuckled.. not sure if they do that, and mine was pretty much a medium.

excerpts: Three words: Fresh Banana Shake.
It's amazing!!!
I had my first one when I had terrible morning sickness and the only thing that even remotely sounded appealing was a milkshake.
I'm now 8 months pregnant, and even after drinking several of these shakes over the months, I still love them!
Not too thick but still creamy, with real banana blended in.
Absolutely delicious -- definitely the best shake in town!
fresh banana shake.author: D. S.
fresh banana shake.review: Three words: Fresh Banana Shake. It's amazing!!! I had my first one when I had terrible morning sickness and the only thing that even remotely sounded appealing was a milkshake. I'm now 8 months pregnant, and even after drinking several of these shakes over the months, I still love them! Not too thick but still creamy, with real banana blended in. Absolutely delicious -- definitely the best shake in town!

excerpts: That, plus waffle fries and half a fresh banana shake, left me in food coma all Sunday.
fresh banana shake.author: Dana S.
fresh banana shake.review:
Confession one:  I am a vegetarian who hates veggie burgers.  It's like eating a bread sandwich, but worse--I mean, I actually like bread. 

Confession two:  I a sucker for anything old and/or divey.  

So when the boy, on an eager quest to find the best burger in the city, said 'Whiz Burger', I was in.  When he said 'the veggie burgers are really good' I was skeptical.  

I am happy to report that--omg--the veggie burgers are. really. good.  They're made of tofu and vegetables and get crispy on the outside, and are nothing at all like a bread sandwich. 

That, plus waffle fries and half a fresh banana shake, left me in food coma all Sunday.

excerpts: I think I have just consumed the greatest fresh banana shake ever, accompanied by a pretty good veggie burger (with cheddar) and crosscut fries.
Fourth star for the shake, for sure.
fresh banana shake.author: Maximillian M.
fresh banana shake.review: I think I have just consumed the greatest fresh banana shake ever, accompanied by a pretty good veggie burger (with cheddar) and crosscut fries. Fourth star for the shake, for sure.

excerpts: they're all good but the fresh banana shake is the best.
fresh banana shake.author: Kristie P.
fresh banana shake.review:
personally, i think whiz burger has the best veggie burger in the city.  it comes with all the fixin's and it's a wildwood tofu burger which is the cream of the crop as far as veggie burgers are concerned.  they put lots of pickles on your veggie burger which i like and it's best with cheese and avocado.  one thing is that they don't put ketchup on your burger, you have to add that yourself. and, if you get it to go on a regular basis you'll end up with a drawer full of ketchup packets.

you have to get a shake if you go!  they're all good but the fresh banana shake is the best.

i would give whiz 5 stars but sometimes their french fries are less than stellar.  usually i think they are good and crispy but every now and then i get a bad batch.

excerpts: Fries were great, as was the Mango Shake, burger was pretty damn good too !
Nice people working the counter too !
Hubby had a steak sandwich that was "just okay",
(but he does get a little picky about steak hence the four star review vs. a five star review).
mango shake.author: Lee P.
mango shake.review: I'm born and raised in The City, and I finally got to stop by for a burger, fries and a shake. Fries were great, as was the Mango Shake, burger was pretty damn good too ! Nice people working the counter too ! Hubby had a steak sandwich that was "just okay", (but he does get a little picky about steak hence the four star review vs. a five star review).

excerpts: Maybe I'll try the chocolate or the mango shake.
mango shake.author: Akasha A.
mango shake.review:
Oh yes, I was starving today between lunch and dinner. How starving? I was running errands and had the urge to gnaw my own foot off. Luckily I drove th Whiz. The place looks like something from the past and I rolled up for a jr. burger and a strawberry shake. 

The burger reminded me of one I had as a kid, so I am pleased. The shake was just OK, but I'll be back for the burgers and the fries I saw other customers chowing down on. Maybe I'll try the chocolate or the mango shake.

Plus, how can ya hate a place with chili dogs?

excerpts: the cross cut fries are crispety crunchety good, so are the shake offerings (hmmmmm... mango shake)
AND they have corn dogs.
There was a time that I craved WB but got dissuaded by my friends and went to a vegan place instead.
THAT was a mistake.
I was depressed for days, only to be cured by the tasty goodness housed on the corner that WB occupies.
mango shake.author: ray e.
mango shake.review: it's another "WTF? I haven't reviewed Whiz Burgers?! How could that be?" After all, the irresistible Whiz Burger (served on a french roll, with bacon AND avocado and the usual burger makings, then neatly wrapped and cut in half even though gluttons like me will just consume the whole thing in one sitting). the cross cut fries are crispety crunchety good, so are the shake offerings (hmmmmm... mango shake) AND they have corn dogs. There was a time that I craved WB but got dissuaded by my friends and went to a vegan place instead. THAT was a mistake. I was depressed for days, only to be cured by the tasty goodness housed on the corner that WB occupies.
